questions.text: Legal name of the food business operator
questions.description: Enter the registered legal name of the business responsible for food safety at this site. This HACCP draft will be generated specifically for this business.
Upload your logo to include it on the cover page of your HACCP plan.

questions.text: Food production site address (if different from registered office)
questions.description: HACCP plans are site-specific. If this plan applies to a specific production site, enter the address here.

options: A defined group of similar products
A defined process or production line

questions.text: Describe the scope covered by this HACCP draft
questions.description: This HACCP draft assumes similar hazards across the defined scope. Differences in ingredients, allergens, or processing may introduce unassessed hazards.

questions.text: Name of product, product group, or process covered
questions.description: Use a clear, descriptive name (e.g. “Chilled ready-to-eat sandwiches” or “Cooked chicken products”).
Select the option that best describes the product at the point of consumer sale. Categories are indicative and used to assist hazard identification. They may not capture all product-specific risks.
List all major ingredients and components. Hazard identification will rely on the information entered here.

questions.text: Allergens intentionally present in the product
questions.description: This does not replace allergen risk assessment or cross-contact controls. Verification by a competent person is required.
Example: plastic film, vacuum pack, glass jar, cardboard box.
If 'Assumption' is selected: Shelf life has not been validated. This HACCP draft must be reviewed and approved by a competent person.

questions.text: I understand this shelf life is not validated.

questions.tooltip: Intended use describes how the product is expected to be used by the consumer, including whether it is ready-to-eat or requires further preparation.

questions.description: Products intended for vulnerable consumers may require additional control measures and validation.

questions.text: I understand that products for vulnerable groups require stricter controls.

questions.description: Products that rely on consumer cooking may still present risks if instructions are not followed.
Reasonably foreseeable misuse must be considered in hazard analysis.
